definition: calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly

sentences.english: Then he sat down next to Voisin and began to write, carefully, without hurry, a thin legible hand.
sentences.chinese: 他不慌不忙，認認真真地寫下一串纖細而清晰的字跡。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor deliberately walked into the river, and clutched Cowherd.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝不慌不忙的走入水中，抓住牛郎。

sentences.english: You can discuss with your manager, and take some time off when it is not busy.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和你的主管談，不忙的時候可以補休。

sentences.english: This no-rush attitude doesn’t represent doing less or having a lower productivity.
sentences.chinese: 這種不慌不忙的態度並不代表做的少或者產量低。

sentences.english: But my friend the sun knew what to do.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友太陽，不慌也不忙。

sentences.english: She was in no hurry, relishing each blossom as a rare and delicate treasure.
sentences.chinese: 她不慌不忙，像欣賞稀有珍寶似地欣賞着每一朵花。

sentences.english: He's taking his time looking for work.
sentences.chinese: 現在他正在不慌不忙地找工作。

sentences.english: He pressed resolutely forward, still without haste, but with dogged fixity of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 他奮力向前走去，仍舊那樣不慌不忙，但是目標堅定。

sentences.english: He decided to hold off going on vacation until he was less busy work.
sentences.chinese: 他決定延後到他的工作不忙時才度假。

sentences.english: I put much emphasis on free-and-easy-going.
sentences.chinese: 我很重視自由及不慌不忙。

sentences.english: Start giving at least one hour to non-occupation.
sentences.chinese: 開始給不忙至少留一個小時。

sentences.english: He in no hurrily ask a professor at this time incognizant I?
sentences.chinese: 這時他不慌不忙的問教授你不認識我嗎？

sentences.english: Slowly he pulled the letter out of the envelop, and unfolded it.
sentences.chinese: 他不慌不忙地將信從信封裏取出打開來。

sentences.english: I want to see you this evening if you are not too busy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不忙的話我想今天晚上和你見面。

sentences.english: A leisurely process of decision - making creates a presumption in favor of eventual inaction.
sentences.chinese: 不慌不忙地作決定就會使人猜測是打算不了了之。
公主不慌不忙地揭下面紗。

definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
